messages.content: You are a helpful assistant.
What is the purpose of an Idea roll in the game?
The goal of an Idea roll is always “to get the investigation back on track”.
You are a helpful assistant.
How does the difficulty level for the Idea roll determine work?
The Keeper starts by figuring out which was the most important clue the players missed and uses this to set a difficulty level for the Idea roll.
You are a helpful assistant.
Who determines the difficulty level for the Idea roll?
The Keeper determines the difficulty level for the Idea roll.
You are a helpful assistant.
What determines the outcome of an Idea roll?
The roll determines not if, but how they get the clue.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the primary goal of an Idea roll?
to get the investigation back on track
You are a helpful assistant.
How does the Keeper determine the difficulty level for the Idea roll?
by figuring out the most important clue the players missed
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the attitude the Keeper should try to have when dealing with players who want to call the police?
Yes, and…
You are a helpful assistant.
What happens to the phone line when the Keeper says 'Yes, and…'?
The phone line is cut off
You are a helpful assistant.
What happens when the Keeper says 'Yes, but…'?
A corrupt policeman turns up
You are a helpful assistant.
Why is it not a pleasing option for anyone if the Keeper says 'No'?
Because it goes against the spirit of the game
You are a helpful assistant.
What is an alternative to a flat 'No' in the game?
An attitude of 'Yes, and...' or 'Yes, but...' instead of a flat 'No'.
You are a helpful assistant.
What might happen if the Keeper allows the players to call the police?
The Keeper might tell how the phone line is cut off or the police station unobtainable, or that only strange un-earthly voices can be heard on the line.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the consequence if a policeman is corrupt and in league with the cult?
The players may not get the information they need, as the Keeper has already said it is not in the spirit of the game.
You are a helpful assistant.
How do the players perceive the game world?
The players' perception of the game world is formed by what you tell them; they cannot perceive what is in your head, only what you say.
You are a helpful assistant.
What happens if the Keeper never mentioned the clue?
The difficulty level is Regular, requiring the player to roll equal to or less than their investigator’s INT.
You are a helpful assistant.
How does the Keeper inform the players about the situation?
The Keeper might tell how the phone line is cut off or the police station unobtainable, or that only strange un-earthly voices can be heard on the line.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the goal of the Keeper in a game?
The players’ perception of the game world is formed by what you tell them; they cannot perceive what is in your head, only what you say.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the difficulty level of a roll if the Keeper never mentioned the clue?
The difficulty level is Regular, requiring the player to roll equal to or less than their investigator’s INT.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the difficulty level if the Keeper never mentioned the clue?
Regular (requiring the player to roll equal to or less than their investigator’s INT)
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the difficulty level if the clue was definitely mentioned (but not emphasized)?
Hard
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the default difficulty level for an Idea roll if weeks of real world time have passed since the clue was mentioned?
Regular
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the difficulty level if the clue was made clear by the Keeper or the players discussed it themselves?
Extreme
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the default difficulty level for an Idea roll?
This is the default difficulty level for an Idea roll.
You are a helpful assistant.
Under what conditions does the difficulty level of an Idea roll become Extreme?
If the clue was made clear by the Keeper (i.e. mentioned several times) or the players discussed it themselves.
You are a helpful assistant.
Why does the Keeper make the Idea roll more difficult?
The Keeper is offering the players a gamble, asking them to risk the negative consequences to gain the clue.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the Keeper's intention in setting the difficulty level of an Idea roll?
The Keeper is not trying to figure out the likelihood of the investigators realizing the clue, but rather offering the players a gamble.
